posts.title: 𝗥𝗲𝘃𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗮𝗸-𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝘄𝗼𝗼𝗹, 𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝗿𝗸𝗲𝘁 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 YK Poudel Bhutan s highland commun...
posts.description: 𝗥𝗲𝘃𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗮𝗸-𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝘄𝗼𝗼𝗹, 𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝗿𝗸𝗲𝘁 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 YK Poudel Bhutan s highland communities are set to benefit from new initiatives aimed at revitalising yak-rearing by promoting fibre production, rangeland development, and global market access. Officials say the move is designed to offer sustainable livelihoods, preserve cultural traditions, and unlock the economic potential of high-value yak wool exports. https:  kuenselonline.com ... reviving-yak-rearing... #yak #wool #highland #fibre #culture #traition #export #Bhutan
posts.content: 𝗥𝗲𝘃𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗮𝗸-𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝘄𝗼𝗼𝗹, 𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝗿𝗸𝗲𝘁 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 YK Poudel Bhutan s highland communities are set to benefit from new initiatives aimed at revitalising yak-rearing by promoting fibre production, rangeland development, and global market access. Officials say the move is designed to offer sustainable livelihoods, preserve cultural traditions, and unlock the economic potential of high-value yak wool exports. https:  kuenselonline.com ... reviving-yak-rearing... #yak #wool #highland #fibre #culture #traition #export #Bhutan

posts.title: 𝗕𝗵𝘂𝘁𝗮𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝟱,𝟬𝟬𝟬𝗠𝗧 𝗳𝗲𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗻𝘂𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮 YK Poudel In a move to curb illegal impo...
posts.description: 𝗕𝗵𝘂𝘁𝗮𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝟱,𝟬𝟬𝟬𝗠𝗧 𝗳𝗲𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗻𝘂𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮 YK Poudel In a move to curb illegal imports and ensure timely access to agricultural inputs, the National Seed Centre, Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock (MoAL) signed an agreement with Brahmaputra Valley Fertilizer Corporation Limited (BVFCL) yesterday to import 5,000 metric tonnes of fertilisers annually. https:  kuenselonline.com ... bhutan-to-import-5000mt... #fertilisers #agriculture #import #Bhutan
posts.content: 𝗕𝗵𝘂𝘁𝗮𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝟱,𝟬𝟬𝟬𝗠𝗧 𝗳𝗲𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗻𝘂𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮 YK Poudel In a move to curb illegal imports and ensure timely access to agricultural inputs, the National Seed Centre, Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock (MoAL) signed an agreement with Brahmaputra Valley Fertilizer Corporation Limited (BVFCL) yesterday to import 5,000 metric tonnes of fertilisers annually. https:  kuenselonline.com ... bhutan-to-import-5000mt... #fertilisers #agriculture #import #Bhutan
